/**
 * The Message class represents a message object that can be sent to recipients.
 * This class contains methods to set and retrieve the message ID, recipient MIDs, and parent message ID.
 * 
 * The main functionalities of this class include:
 * - Setting and retrieving the message ID using the setMessageId and getMessageId methods.
 * - Setting and retrieving the recipient MIDs using the setTo and getTo methods.
 * - Retrieving the parent message ID associated with the message using the getParentMessageId method.
 * 
 * Overall, the Message class provides functionality to manage message objects within a system, including setting and retrieving message IDs, recipient MIDs, and parent message IDs.
 */
/**
 * This class represents a message object with various properties such as parent message ID, sender ID, and subject.
 * It provides methods to set and retrieve these properties, as well as generate JavaDoc comments for each method.
 * 
 * The main functionalities of this class include:
 * - Setting and getting the parent message ID for a message
 * - Setting and getting the sender ID for a message
 * - Setting and getting the subject of a message
 * 
 * The overall behavior of this class is to encapsulate message data and provide convenient methods for interacting with it.
 * It ensures data integrity by enforcing constraints such as non-negative values for certain properties.
 * 
 * Note: This class does not handle message sending or receiving functionality, it is purely for data representation and manipulation.
 */

/**
 * The Message class represents a message that can be sent or received.
 * It contains information such as the sender, recipient, subject, body, and timestamp.
 * This class provides methods to set and get the various attributes of the message.
 * 
 * The main functionalities of this class include:
 * - Setting and getting the sender and recipient of the message
 * - Setting and getting the subject of the message
 * - Setting and getting the body of the message
 * - Setting and getting the timestamp representing the date and time when the message was sent
 * 
 * The overall behavior of this class is to encapsulate the data related to a message and provide
 * methods to manipulate and access this data. It allows users to create, send, and receive messages
 * in a structured and organized manner.
 */
/**
 * The MessageBean class represents a message entity with various attributes such as sender, receiver, message ID, subject, body, timestamp, and read status.
 * This class provides methods to get and set these attributes, allowing for manipulation and retrieval of message data.
 * 
 * Main functionalities include:
 * - Setting and getting sender, receiver, message ID, parent message ID, subject, body, timestamp, and read status.
 * - Providing accessors and mutators for each attribute to enable data manipulation.
 * 
 * Overall behavior:
 * - Allows for the creation, modification, and retrieval of message data.
 * - Encapsulates message information within a single object for easy management and processing.
 * - Supports tracking of message read status to indicate whether a message has been read or not.
 */
